segment.source: generalize
segment.target: generalize

segment.source: generalize
segment.target: generalize

segment.source: generalize
segment.target: generalize

segment.source: The generalize configuration pass of Windows® Setup is used to create a Windows reference image that can be used throughout an organization.
segment.target: The generalize configuration pass of Windows® Setup is used to create a Windows reference image that can be used throughout an organization.

segment.source: Settings in the generalize configuration pass enable you to automate the behavior for all deployments of this reference image.
segment.target: Settings in the generalize configuration pass enable you to automate the behavior for all deployments of this reference image.

segment.source: In comparison, settings applied in the specialize configuration pass enable you to override behavior for a single, specific deployment.
segment.target: In comparison, settings applied in the specialize configuration pass enable you to override behavior for a single, specific deployment.

segment.source: When a system is generalized, specific configuration data for a given installation of Windows is removed.
segment.target: When a system is generalized, specific configuration data for a given installation of Windows is removed.

segment.source: For example, during the generalize configuration pass, the unique security ID (SID) and other hardware-specific settings are removed from the image.
segment.target: For example, during the generalize configuration pass, the unique security ID (SID) and other hardware-specific settings are removed from the image.

segment.source: The generalize configuration pass runs only when you use the Sysprep command with the /generalize option.
segment.target: The generalize configuration pass runs only when you use the Sysprep command with the /generalize option.

segment.source: Answer file settings in the section of an answer file are applied to the system before Sysprep generalization occurs.
segment.target: Answer file settings in the section of an answer file are applied to the system before Sysprep generalization occurs.

segment.source: The system then shuts down.
segment.target: The system then shuts down.

segment.source: The following diagram shows the process of the generalize configuration pass.
segment.target: The following diagram shows the process of the generalize configuration pass.

segment.source: generalize configuration pass
segment.target: generalize configuration pass

segment.source: The specialize configuration pass runs immediately after the next time that the system boots.
segment.target: The specialize configuration pass runs immediately after the next time that the system boots.

segment.source: When you run Sysprep, you can decide whether Windows will boot to audit mode or Windows Welcome by specifying /audit or /oobe.
segment.target: When you run Sysprep, you can decide whether Windows will boot to audit mode or Windows Welcome by specifying /audit or /oobe.

segment.source: The specialize configuration pass always runs after a computer has been generalized, regardless of whether the computer is configured to boot to audit mode or Windows Welcome.
segment.target: The specialize configuration pass always runs after a computer has been generalized, regardless of whether the computer is configured to boot to audit mode or Windows Welcome.

segment.source: Any method of moving or copying a Windows image to a new computer must be prepared with the sysprep /generalize command.
segment.target: Any method of moving or copying a Windows image to a new computer must be prepared with the sysprep /generalize command.

segment.source: For more information, see Sysprep (Generalize) a Windows installation.
segment.target: For more information, see Sysprep (Generalize) a Windows installation.
